thread.title: What channel is Bills-Bengals on? TV, time, radio stations, live stream information
thread.title_full: What channel is Bills-Bengals on? TV, time, radio stations, live stream information | syracuse.com

author: Matthew Fairburn | mfairburn@syracuse.com
title: What channel is Bills-Bengals on? TV, time, radio stations, live stream information
text:
Orchard Park, N.Y. — The Buffalo Bills have to start making good on their home-field advantage.
In three home games, the Bills are just 1-2 and twice have allowed penalties to cause their downfall. They now have the tough task of taking on Andy Dalton and the undefeated Cincinnati Bengals, who are fresh off a comeback win over the Seattle Seahawks. The Bills could again be shorthanded, as quarterback Tyrod Taylor, LeSean McCoy, Sammy Watkins and Karlos Williams all appeared on the Week 6 injury report.
The game will begin at 1 p.m. on CBS. Here's how to watch:
CBS Below are the channel numbers for CBS in the Syracuse area:
Time Warner: Channel 1209 (HD) and 5 for non-digital customers Verizon Fios: Channel 505 (HD) and 5 (SD) DirectTV: Channel 5 (SD & HD) Dish Network: Channel 5 (SD &HD) New Visions: Channel 605 (HD) and 5 (SD) You can also watch online or through tablets and mobile devices using FOX Sports GO .
Radio Syracuse — WKRL (100.9 FM), Buffalo – WGR (550 AM); Ithaca — WYXL (98.7 FM); Rochester — WCMF (96.5 FM) and WROC (950 AM). Complete list of Bills radio affiliates
